result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Raymond A. Mansavage was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $600 plus costs ($1,694.00).  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
Defendant is to pay the attorney fees and Court will continue the garnishment.  After attorney fees are completed, the garnishment is to contiue to pay the fines and costs.

May serve second half on home monitor program if the defendant qualifies for the program.  Defendant is to be assessed by the Sheriff's Department. 
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
Defendant will get credit for any administrative suspension.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond A. Mansavage in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-115 and 15CT-37.

9:14 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to 15CM-115  - Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed. Count 3 and Count 4 would be dismissed and read in. 15CT-37 would be dismissed and read in as well.

State recommends aggravated guidelines.
Defense is free to argue.

Atty Dalkert concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Dalkert for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM-115: Count 1: OWI 2nd offense
15CM-115: Count 2: Dismissed
15CM-115: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-115: Dismissed and Read In
15CT-37: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Dalkert makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends a lower category. PBT: .191

Court believes plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 50 Days
May serve second half on home monitor program if Defendant qualifies for the program. Defendant is to be assessed by the Sheriff's Department.
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay a fine and costs totaling $1,694 ($600 fine plus costs)
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Drivers License Revoked 17 Months
Defendant will get credit for any administrative suspension 
IID 17 Months, effective TODAY
DOT Assessment  and comply with recommendations BAC: .222
Defendant is to pay the attorney fees and Court will continue the garnishment. After attorney fees are completed, the garnishment is to continue to pay the fines and costs
